text:
Seorang teman dan saya baru-baru ini menghabiskan 7 malam di apartemen Beach Melati dan kami sangat senang dengan kunjungan kami disana. Kami berada di apartemen 202 yang luas dengan balkon semi-privat yang besar yang menghadap ke kolam renang. Bagian Rumah tangga terus membuat kamar bersih cemerlang setiap hari dan itu bagus, dan apartemen kami memiliki sofa yang nyaman, kasur, kamar mandi bersih dan segala yang Anda butuhkan. Kami berada di sana selama periode tahun baru yang sibuk dan meskipun semua apartemen telah dipesan, kami tidak pernah merasa tempat ini penuh sesak ataupun berisik dan 9/10 kali Anda dapat menggunakan kolam renang secara pribadi. Staf yang selalu membantu dan layanan kamar dari beberapa restoran berafiliasi dengan tempat ini bekerja dengan  cepat dan tepat, Meskipun apa pun yang Anda butuhkan berjarak sangat dekat. Jalan masuk pribadi ke pantai juga bagus (meskipun sering banjir selama musim hujan, sekedar tip!). Secara keseluruhan tempat ini ramah, bersih, proses check-in dan check-out yang mudah dan praktis, dan pengunjung lainnya yang bersahabat.

Satu-satunya kekurangan dari SEMUA aspek positif yang kita dapat adalah dispenser air kosong ketika kami tiba dan kita harus membayar untuk menggantinya (kami pikir hal ini termasuk bagian dari tarif kamar). Kami juga tidak menyadari internet wifi harus dibeli dengan kartu prabayar, dan kartu 5 jam yang kami beli pasti tidak memberi kami 5 jam yang senilai - namun bukan salah tempat ini, tapi merupakan tanggung jawab penyedia internet. Hal ini bukan masalah besar karena pada dasarnya di Bali di mana-mana tersedia wifi gratis!

Saya pasti merekomendasikan Beach Apartments Melati untuk orang yang mencari tempat yang lebih santai dan privat namun dekat dengan pusat aktvitas (tapi lihatlah di peta sebelumnya untuk menemukan beberapa tujuan, karena sopir taksi kami mengalami kesulitan menemukannya!)
title: Pelarian yang bagus dari pusat aktivitas.

text: Wow... totally recommend...just spent 10 days in Beach Melati Apartments in Legian, as family of 4. What an awesome position.... right in the heart of Legian... close to everything (directly across from Poco Loco and next door to Romeos) and priced so cheap. Many restaurants to choose from right outside the door.. laundry service across the road ($1.50 a kg). Started in a 2 bdrm apartment, then upgraded to a 3 bdrm. Both so spacious, Comfy beds, 3 bdrm can sleep 7 without using large sofas and daybed. So clean, and most important - the best water pressure in the showers and never ran out of hot water once. Apartments as shown on website. Pool was great, gets lots of sun. Very quiet for where it is positioned, so close to everything. Upstairs had the best ocean breeze. The staff were so accommodating and very friendly. We will definitely found our home base in Legian for all our holidays.

The second room had 2 single beds which was perfect for my teenage children who didnt want to sleep together. Hubby loved the large sized fridge in the apartment enough for all his bintang. The lovely staff clean your apartment daily but most days we asked for towels only. There is always a staff member on duty. You cant walk down the laneway anymore to the beach as its blocked off due to renovations in the Villas at the back. One o across the road is great we ordered cocktails around the pool with them. La Monde down the road further is also a winner. They have a small 24 hour shop in the front of the apartments where we stocked up on drinks and snacks. Yuda man picked us up from the airport, he was there on time to greet us and is such a funny guy. They also can organise tours for you. 
Thank you again for our wonderful stay we Will be back next year 
Sutherlands family

text: I recently stayed at Beach Melati apartments with two girlfriends. The apartments are situated centrally in Legian between the Camakila and the Ossotel. There are 12 apartments over 3 levels with 2 x 3 bedroom apartments on the top level. I think the other 10 apartments are all two bedroom. Our apartment was on the second level. The apartment was enormous, with two bedrooms containing a king size bed & two king singles. It had a huge lounge room and fully self contained kitchen. Our apartment also had a water cooler. For $3 you can arrange for a container of water for the cooler (a nice touch would be for this to be a free option). The bathroom was also large & well maintained. I felt safe the whole stay as security is at the property 24/7. Whilst the apartments were full for most of our stay we pretty much had the pool all to our selves. There is only room for 5 sun beds around the pool and the pool is only small but was perfect for cooling down in. The central location gave easy access to shopping, restaurants & the beach. If you want icy cold bintangs, turn left at the front and follow the road around until you find “kevins” convenience store. He keeps a dozen beers in the freezer and was happy for us to borrow a basket to transport our purchase. We had a fabulous time & will be back with our families next time.
title: Fantastic spacious apartments

text: Better than a hotel!  We were in search of an apartment for a three week stay,previously have stayed for years at the Bali Court Hotel, but nothing was available.  Found Beach Melati online and from the pictures it looked the same as the Bali Court architecturally.  Booking was pleasantly cordial with Jinae, as we requested a two bedroom unit on the second with lots of light.  On arrival, we were booked into 201 and it was perfect!  Quiet, private, spacious and comfortable.  Full size refrigerator, microwave, a good desk and side working area.  A long table at the back of the great L-shaped sofa. The AC worked well.  This apartment has it's own staircase from the outside.  The bedrooms are at the back of the apartment and very quiet. We would have like a chaise for the balcony and robe hooks in the bathroom and bedrooms.  It's a few seconds walk to the main road there Jl Padma Utara, the the One-O Restaurant across the street is delicious.  We had dinner a couple of times at the Niksoma next door, the Souvlaki  Greek Restaurant and Sasa Italian Restaurant on Double Six (Jl Arjuna)  All scrumptious!  A cab ride will take you to the Bali Bakery restaurant on Jl. Imam Bonjoul (across from Centro Parkir where the buses park)--also a favorite of ours!  Getting back to the Beach Melati,For two nights we had a ground floor 2 bedroom apt next  to the pool--all the ground floor apartments are poolside, so if you like being near the pool, these are for you!  201 had been booked for those two nights, so we packed up, the staff moved our luggage, it was easy.  The staff is friendly and very helpful, and under the pressure of an earthquake which happened during our stay, they alerted everyone and made sure we were all out and onto the street. Beach Melati is a winner!
title: Private and quiet in a busy area!

text: Beach Melati Apts is in a great location and the rooms are very nice, however they are not a family friendly environment. We were two families staying in two seperate ground floor apartments, between us we had 4 children between the ages of 6 and 10. During the day the children naturally wanted to swim in the pool, at all times there were at least 2 adults supervising them. They were happy, laughing, splashing etc as all children do. We had 5 older family members in 2 apartments upstairs who said the children were no problem. Almost from the first day a lady in another ground floor apt complained about the noise and splashing. We tried to keep the children out of the pool as much as we could, and were often away doing other activities, however the complaints came every time the children were in the pool. This really affected our enjoyment of our holiday and we felt very uncomfortable! The children were never unruly or undisciplined, they were just enjoying the pool on a hot day! Don't stay here if you have children who wish to use the pool!
title: Not Family Friendly

text: Stayed 5 nights at Melati with our children who are 7 and 9 and with another couple with similar aged children.  On our third day, we were asked by staff to check our emails. We had no idea why. We then find that we had been sent a warning email, then a second email telling us that we're being evicted from the apartments. All news to us. Our kids were supposedly making too much noise and splashing water while playing in the pool. We hardly used the pool while we were there. Our kids were by no means excessively noisy, just normal kids playing in a pool on holiday. We suspect the complaint came from one elderly woman who seemed to be a semi permanent resident there. They tried telling us there had been four seperate complaints but that was just rubbish as most of the apartments there had been booked by family and friends. We were gobsmacked at being treated the way we were. Don't choose these apartments if you have children who enjoy a dip in the pool while in their holidays!
title: Kids not welcome here!

owner_response.text:
Thanks for taking the time to review and I'm happy to respond. The behavior of your group (consisting of 3 apartments out of 12) was disruptive and annoying to other guests. Our staff spoke to your children on numerous occasions when they were throwing rocks or bombing into the pool. Their behavior made it impossible for other guests to use the pool area which was constantly flooded with water pouring out our gates. The children ignored the staff's requests to stop. After receiving 4 written complaints from 3 other guests we emailed asking that the children be supervised. Other guests were then bullied with comments about them complaining and felt very uncomfortable whenever your group were there. We discussed the matter with booking .com who advised us how to handle your booking and assisted us in wording our email asking you to leave with the offer of a refund for remaining nights. Their other suggestion was that we involve the police which we were not keen to do. text: Our family of four stayed 10 nights in the 3 bedroom, 1 bath apartment on the 3rd floor. Late arrival, driver waiting, who escorted us to our accommodation and check in sorted next morning. The living area of the apartment was huge, with good sized bedrooms. Big screen TV in lounge and flat screens in 2 of the bedrooms. The hot/cold water dispenser cost 30,000RP ($3 AUD) for 19 litres and the boys would go get one and have it installed when we got back from lunch. Our balcony overlooked the pool and street, which I would watch while having my morning coffee, enjoying the banter between street vendors and tourists. A 24 hr Circle K 50m from front of building and "One O" directly across the road for great brekkies which they would deliver if I called and asked (They let me take a menu back to our apartment), bars and restaurants within easy walking distance made the location ideal. My son would take the alleyway to the beach for surf and beers with locals. Although there was some street noise in the mornings, it didn't really bother us. owner_response.text:
I have discussed this at length with our staff as I have already replied to your wife's review below.
It is our policy to request payment on arrival and this is detailed in your booking confirmation from us. The reason for this is that unfortunately some guests would depart without paying so we changed our payment conditions several years ago.
It is unfortunate your flight was delayed however this was out of our control. 
I understand that our staff helped with your luggage when you arrived and assisted with carrying your stroller to the apartment whenever they were there and could see you leaving or arriving.
I agree it is difficult to park a car in our area unless you are staying in one of the big resorts like Jayakarta or Ramada who have car parking available. They also have lifts available which might make it easier for your access with yur child.
Thank you for taking the time to post a review.

text:
We like the spacious apartment, big comfy sofa, big bed, kitchen with fridge, water dispenser and microwave. Also our private balcony. The pool is nice as well where we dont need to share with too many people. We like the private feeling of the apartment and the space. 

What we dont fancy is that the apartment has no car access. And no lift, which was hard with a baby and a stroller.

What we think this place needs improvement is the way the staff welcome the guest. When we arrived, we had delayed flight with a 6 months old baby, so we were very tired. The staff straight away asked us to pay the balance. It would be nice if the staff welcomed us with smile, and cold drinks. Or even offered us to sit. It wasnt a nice experience when we arrive. You should train your staff to be nice, friendly to guest when they just arrive from delayed flight. Your front office staff needs more customer service training. But it was only one that staff who had an attitude. The rest of your staff were nice n friendly.

Thank you for having us.

text:
We just got back from Bali (last weekend). We stayed at Apartment #103 (1 bedroom) on the ground floor. We were very pleased with the unit because:

1. The unit was huge. It had 1 spacious bedroom with a TV, a closet, an ironing board and a safe deposit box. The bathroom was spacious, too (shower only, no bath tub). The living room was quite big, with an L-shapped sofa, another TV & dvd player. The kitchen was compact yet complete, equipped with a microwave, huge sink, tablewares, an electronic water kettle, 2-door fridge & a bread toaster.

2. The swimming pool was right in front of our door. Yes, there was a kid's pool, my boys could swim without making me worry too much. And most importantly, the pool was clean.

3. The apartment was well-managed & well-decorated. Really felt like my own home... but better... Because I don't have to clean it myself hahaha..

4. The Legian beach was in walking distance. But we had to go through a narrow alley. Don't want to know how it's like when it's dark...

5. We had a pretty decent sleep at night, though there were some people lounging & chatting around the swimming pool, & a live-music bar across the street. And we were so lucky to have nice & friendly neighbours, that they didn't make any irritating noise.

However, the downsides were:
1. No car parking space. If you bring a car, you will have to park it at an empty lawn near the hotel (ask for the staff's help to guide you there).

2. The floor was somehow dusty or sandy, even though I knew they had already cleaned our unit. And no in-room slippers. (Yup, this was a problem for me as a clean-freak).

3. In the bathroom, there were only 2 bath towels, no hand towel. And only 1 floor mat, which was not absorbent enough. And my boys kept walking back-and-forth from the pool to our unit. 

4. When we checked in, we were asked to pay in advance for our booking. We found this was a bit inconvenient for us, because we weren't informed about this matter when we made our booking. (We were only asked to pay the deposit).

Conclusion: yes, I would definitely recommend this accommodation.

I don't provide any photos of the apartment here. But you can see them in Google & TripAdvisor, the photos were true. Although the swimming pool looked bigger in the photos, if I might say..
title: Felt like home, but better :)

text:
This is our second stay at the Beach Melati and it was just as good as the first.
We had the two bedroom on the ground floor, which is perfect for us with two small kids.
The apartment was modern and spacious with everything you need. The staff kept it clean and tidy daily and nothing was ever too much to ask.
It is so central to everything you need, restaurants and the beach literally a minute away, but as soon as you walk into the apartment block it's as if you leave it all behind. This also made us feel really safe of a night as it is secure and has night security also.
The pool is beautiful and clean and very rarely do the guests overlap swim times, so we usually had it to ourselves!
The cafe out the front does amazing food and were more than happy to deliver it to the room, which is great with the kids.
The staff are all great. Jinae makes the booking process so easy and the boys are super friendly and awesome with the kids.
My only tip, When staying on the ground floor, ask for rooms on the beach side of the apartment block as it can be pretty noisy at night next to the road as the restaurant over the road plays live music and the locals hang out the front. In saying that, we stayed there a month and I wouldn't say I ever lost sleep.
If you like to be central, but avoid the super touristy crowd - this is the place!

Only downside for me was that the pool area is quite small with only a few sun lounges and whilst its probably good for some that its shaded all day, I personally like a bit of sun to dry off after a swim and had to sit on the edge of the pool to do that. I think we were a bad fit for the place - if you like loud Aussies bombdiving in pools at 10pm and smoking and drinking all day around a pool that's right outside your window you'll probably love the place.

text:
Love Beach Melati!! We recently stayed for 7 nights in a 2 bedroom apt (Room 105) and we loved it. The room was huge, beds were comfy, air-conditioning worked perfectly. The hotel & pool area is very clean. Our room was on the ground floor facing the pool. Wi-fi is free and had good connection. 
We travelled with friends who stayed in the 3 bedroom apartment on the top floor and that was enormous, it also had a large outdoor deck area with sun lounges & outdoor setting. We travelled with 6 kids between our 2 families, so the apartments were great giving everyone plenty of space to spread out. The location is perfect, really close to many great restaurants, day spas, shopping, mugshot coffee, money changers & a short walk down the lane to the beach. 
The staff Jinae, Yuda, Wayan and the other boys are really friendly and make you feel very welcome, nothing is too much trouble. We organised our airport transfers and a day trip through them and the prices were very reasonable.
There is no restaurant in the hotel, but there are several close by that will deliver straight to your room.
There are only 12 apartments in the complex and while its located on a busy road, once you step inside the front gates you feel miles away from the hustle & bustle going on outside the hotel walls. We loved Beach Melati and will definately stay there again.

This is quite a small complex with about 10 or 11 apartments grouped on 3 storeys around the pool but it is perfectly located in Legian close to all amenities and with it's own path to the beach, about 300 metres away. Possibly because of it's size we found it a very friendly place and have made good friends with lots of our neighbours, including the lovely and knowledgeable Debra O! Our first visit to Bali and won't be our last - despite the flight! We will come back here!

text:
I have travelled to Bali on many occasions and in fact I have stayed in the resorts on either side of this place and had never even known it was there, Tucked away down a beautiful tree lined lane is the melati beach. once inside the gates you are in your own little oasis. It's small, only 11 apartments inside the complex but it's beautifully formed. The pool, is only small but it's all you need and the beach is only 200 meters down the lane. 
Each unit is different, some are only 2 bedroom but the best and most spacious are the two 3 bedroom ones on the top floor. Having said that all the apartments are large and spacious. The rooms all have kitchens so for the budget conscious, it's great to be able to prepare a meal or make breakfast because it's not included.  The staff are wonderful, friendly and helpful and the rooms are cleaned everyday. In fact we have returned to our rooms to find that they had even washed the dishes and put them away. Nothing seems to be a problem for them. All the rooms have lovely outside areas with tables and chairs. The wifi is free and always has a good signal. 
For a family or large group looking for accommodation where you can all be close, this place would be hard to beat. The aircon is great, the fridge is big, the beds are comfy and the location is super.
As with any place there are compromises here. The pool is very deep, it must be 8 foot, so if you are not a competent swimmer that can be a problem, the little pool to the side is shallow but for me who had my 18 month old grand daughter with me it was not appropriate. The pool is being renovated in May and is going to be made more "user friendly" and that will solve that problem.  The room we were in 204 and the one next door 205 while being 2 of the nicest room also back onto the street and were at times a little noisier than the ones that don't but again it was a small compromise.  The 3 bedroom apartments are on the top floor and are huge. Easily sleep 7 in comfort. I actually thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the melati beach and would definitely return but not with a small child. This place is not toddler friendly!!!!!. For a wedding party and guests or for a large family gathering I don't think you could go past it for price, location or convenience. The few compromises are not enough to deter me from returning. There are 2 great day spas 100 meters from the door, a great little cafe adjoining and undoubtedly the best coffee in Bali at " mugshots" across the road. If your after a 5 star experience, this is not the place for you but if your after a home away from home experience, this is hard to find. My suggestion for rooms would be anything on the second or third floor. If you have small kids room 202 and 301 as they can be contained on private balconies. 
In May while the pool is being renovated the apartments are going to be super cheap so if you don't mind the 200 meter walk down to the beach and a little inconvenience, it would be a super cheap holiday with great accomodation, just a thought....
title: Something different.

text: Stayed at Beach Melati Apartments for 2 weeks on the recommendation of a friend. Apartments are modern and great location - closer to Seminyak end of Legian. Small pool, great coffee shop attached to the apartments where you can also get breakfast (breakfast not included in the room price but there is a fully equiped kitchen that you can  make your own food). I would call the complex a small boutique style as it's only 3 levels. All apartments are privately owned so not all are the same decor. Had everything you needed in the rooms, nice bathroom, kitchen, lounge, flat screen tv, dvd player, etc. As for price, for a single, it is probably a bit expensive, however if you had a few people staying, it works out very economical, and you are getting the same standard room as a 5 star hotel - without having to pay for staff and all the other trimmings that you wouldn't use anyway. It does not back onto the beach but is only a 5 minute walk to Legian beach. Right next door to the Ramada Camakila Hotel. If you want to book, I'd suggest booking at least 6 months before as the rooms book out very quickly. No parking for cars but you could park a motorbike out the front on the road. No lift but stairs to upper floors.

text:
I stayed with friends in a two bedroom apartment at Beach Melati Apartments over Easter 2011 (there was 7 of us and we occupied 2 apartments). The apartments are HUGE....which was such a pleasant suprise as it meant our group of friends didn't have to sit on top of each other for the week we were there. The apartment complex is very boutique and with only about 9 apartments in the complex we didn't feel overwhelmed with other people and it was truely relaxing. The pool was lovely and never crouded and the staff were really helpful and very friendly. 
The added bonus of a cafe at the front door that would deliver iced coffee and fresh fruit juice to the apartment really topped off a great stay at Beach Melati Apartments.
title: Perfect location and boutique block made for a relaxing holiday

text:
My husband and I have stayed at Beach Melati apartments twice and will be going back. Our first trip we stayed in 104 (downstairs right next to the pool) and the second in 202 (upstairs with balconies and four poster bed). 

The beauty of the Beach Melati is that you get a whole apartment in a private quiet location with a lovely pool for much less $$ than equivalent accommodation in a  resort. The staff are friendly, helpful  and always available but unobtrusive. The cafe which adjoins the property means you dont have to leave the poolside, but there are many options surrounding you in  legian. Also very close to beach (2 mins walk max). 

Apartments nicely decorated too. Not a hotel, so no spa, but who needs one - there are 2 directly across the road. My #1 pick in south Bali.
title: Gorgeous rooms in boutique apartment block right next to the beach

text:
We stayed 12 nights in these lovely apartments.  Ours was a two bedroom apartment on the first floor (202), but had a look  in other apartments too.   All lovely in their own individual way. Our apartment had two balconies, a larger one overlooking the pool and another out the back facing the neighbours.

Bedrooms had queen size bed, then two singles and we had an extra matress brought in as we have 3 children.  Bedrooms and living area were air-conditioned which we needed.  Living area was very spacious with TV/DVD player and sound system.  Kitchen was great to have even though we didn't make much use of it!  Bathroom was lovely too!  Drains a bit smelly sometimes, but that is Bali! Nothing some incencse won't fix!

Staff were great right from check in.  Couldn't have been more friendly and helpful!  

Pool, not huge like a resort pool, but more than adequate for the amount of people using it.  Always clean! Our kids all loved it, so did we!

Location is perfect too, about a 300m walk up a private laneway for direct beach access or step out the front for access to Legian and all it has to offer.  Many great shops and restaurants just a stone's throw away!  Security is not an issue either with main gate and entrance through coffee shop locked after hours.

Even though The Coffee Shop is a separate business I will mention it here as they do deliver food to the apartments and around the pool.  Best cafe around, most helpful and friendly staff too.  We ate a lot here! 

We have previously stayed in resorts but will definitely stay here again, so much better in all ways. 

Feel free to ask any questions.  Hope this review is helpful.
title: We will be back, loved everything!

text:
We enjoyed our stay at Beach Melati Apartments. We stayed in Room 105 first week. Nice room opens onto the communal pool so no privacy but good for socialising. Once inside the room we didn't hear anything. Later, (we went to Nusa Dua) we stayed in Rm 204.
Upstairs and more private. Bigger beds in this room. Loved our stay there though it did cost more than we normally pay.

text:
We stayed in 301 - 2 Bath, 3 Bed. The apt is large; the 'view' is water glimpses only (sneaky bit of water between palm fronds in the distance) so you're not going to sit on the (large) balcony to watch the ocean. Furnishings were great, beds were comfy, assort of pillows provided.
The only toiletries prov'd is t/paper and soap, so remember to bring yr own shampoo, tissues, etc. A small UHT milk and some tea/coffee/water is waiting for you (and, nicely, mozzie repellent) but conv stores are very close by.  
The kitchen is well eq'd, but there are so many restaurants to choose from within a few metres walking distance. I think that there's supposed to be a bbq on the balcony, but it wasn't there for us?
The air conditioning to this apt was an issue for us.  Two front bedrooms were great (think meat-locker) but main bed and living were just cool at best, kitchen was stifling. Split a/c units only and they are prob not placed well & just not coping with the large area.
3 keys provided for access - all ext doors are key locked inc. a lead-in door to the apt.  The property door leading from an alley way has an unusual locking method of the utilisation of sliding a screwdriver through both handles to that the doors cannot be opened from outside. I'm not sure what would happen if you arrived home after 'screwdriver time'.   
This site has a delightful pool with deckchairs and tables/chairs. The staff are friendly and helpful!
I would definitely stay there again if the a/c was upgraded.
title: Close to everything...great pool!

owner_response.text:
Thank you for your review. We’re glad you enjoyed your stay with us and are sorry you found the air conditioning inadequate. 
We’d like to clarify a couple of points to any potential guests reading. 
301 has never had a bbq - in fact none of our Apartments does. 
The lock on our door to the gang broke and our security guard temporarily used a screwdriver to lock it overnight. It was repaired the next day. He is on duty all night to assist guests and would have opened the door to anyone arriving back late at night.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Located in Seminyak, we always stay at this place when we visit Bali. We have grown used to the location and its relationship with the local amenities. This creates a sense of belonging. Accommodation for us is more than the building and the quality of the mattress.

For us, staying in an apartment, as opposed to a Villa, or a hotel room, is the superior choice. It gives us the independence and privacy that we enjoy. It also gives us that sense of safety that belonging to a small community can bring, temporary though that may be. The manager and staff provide friendly involvement and a hands-on approach that creates and consolidates the overall ambiance and makes you feel that this is where you want to return on your next visit to Bali.

Although, inevitably, this is an ageing property, it enjoys excellent maintenance, as well as sensitive attention to its interior decor that creates the signature luxury look of the place. Each apartment is different, and there are one, two or three bedrooms options.  Each apartment has a kitchenette and facility to prepare and store snacks and beverages. There is only on apartment that has a full kitchen, one of two penthouses. The manager understands  the client community that has grown up around this accommodation, and will attempt to place them into apartments that they have either grown used to or that is going to be the best available match to their needs. The well maintained swimming pool and surrounds gives the place its heartbeat, and is well used by individuals and families who stay there. 

Within walking distance there are breakfast restaurants and amazing dining out options, offering a range of cuisines: South American; Italian; local Indonesian; International. Within a block there is an evening restaurant with a drag floor-show that is lots of fun and to which lots of parents will also take the children.

If you need a tailor, there is one around the corner, if you need a gluten free specialist, also around the corner. Also in the neighbourhood there is an Apotik (pharmacy); 711s for drinks and snack foods; a beauty clinic; 2 medical practices and last but not list, a short block from the beach.

Jalan Legian, the shopping strip is a short two blocks away, and if you are inclined, you can walk to the Kuta shopping area and markets.

Were there any worries: yes, rooms on the street side can be noisy, depending on what is going on with the other businesses on the street. But then if you want easy access, then you are going to share air space with all of these places.

Beach Melati provides access to free WiFi. There is off street-parking if you want to hire a car, which we always do because we like to drive ourselves. There is a very reasonably priced laundry service next to the off street parking.

Room maintenance and cleaning is superior.
Security is provided on a 24/7 basis.
title: Love this Place

text: We travel to Bali on a regular basis and usually stay at a hotel close to these private apartments.We have walked past the gates and always wanted to stay there so this time booked the first two days of our trip.From first enquiry the owner was straight back to us and we made our deposit into an Australian bank account which was very handy.On arrival the apartment was amazing and I hadn’t expected to have such a well maintained complete home.Your own fully functioning kitchen,lounge dining area,bedroom and bathroom.The rooms surround a lovely pool which we basically had to ourselves most of the time.The pool was a little warm but the humidity at this time was at its peak so no fault of theirs.You don’t get breakfast and you are given some basics just to get you through on arrival.After that you need to have your own water,shampoos and teas and coffees which we take anyway.Plenty of good restaurants right outside the complex which are open for breakfast and a 24 hour mini mart right outside your door.Staff were good and there was someone there 24 hours a day.Im not sure what time the door is locked to get in but I’m sure if you were going to be late they would be there to open the gate.Really happy with the short stay we had there and would definately stay again.I wouldn’t advise it for people with children only because it would be too noisy for other guests.I loved the serenity of the whole place even with the busy road out the front
title: Beautiful apartment in great area

owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. We’re pleased you finally decided to stay with us and look forward to seeing you again.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Can’t fault this place at all, it’s such a great find. 
I stayed in apartment 103 1 bedroom ground floor apartment it has a jug, microwave, toaster, great sized fridge, air cons in all rooms, great sized sofa which was comfortable and once the doors were closed it was so quiet.
Staff clean your room daily but if we didn’t want a clean we just told them and they brung us new towels, soap and toilet paper. 
When you arrive they give you a small welcome package with 2 bottles of water, coffee, tea, sugar and some mosquito repellent. We went into the front of the apartments where there is Cocomart (a small supermarket type thing) which had drinks, snacks and everything you needed pretty much. The boys got us a big bottle of aqua water for $3 to put on the machine inside our apartment. This gave us hot,warm and cold water.
The swimming pool was always clean same as the rooms. This place is a hidden gem in the heart of Legian. There also is a money changer inside the Cocomart in the front of the apartments who are very reliable and honest.
title: Best place in Bali!

Our staff member who checked you in had been in a motor bike accident. He explained he could not carry all the bags up but you told him not to worry as you had 2 men and 4 teenage boys in your group. Yes we do take payment on check-in which is clearly advised in our booking confirmation letter. Aircon in every room of your apartment was working and so was WiFi. 
We tried to speak to you about your teenage sons when they were found lighting fireworks and throwing them on to our neighboring family’s Hindu temple but you were out shopping. I hope you wouldn’t allow them to do this at a church in Australia. We did discuss it with the boys uncle who spoke to them about their disrespectful behaviour. 
We also had to ask the boys on numerous occasions to turn their loud music down at the pool as it was disturbing other guests. Again you were out so we emailed you to bring this to your attention. 
Our apartment owners are all Australian or NZers. The guests (from South America) that you are insulting have stayed with us for many years and will continue to do so. 
Our previous reviews and our high ranking reflect what our staff and apartments are really like. We’re very happy that you found other accommodation that tolerated your family’s behaviour.

Have just returned from 5 nights here.  Jinae who is Australian and the owner/manager is such a lovely lady.
We had room 101 which was on the ground floor right next to reception. We could step out of our room into the pool. Very easy check in and check out.  There is no bar or restaurant onsite, however there are many shops and restaurants as soon as you walk out to the main street which is about a 10 second walk from the apartments. text:
We've been to Bali A LOT, and I always do painstaking homework on accommodation before booking anything, so when I find something that lives up to expectations - I'm a very happy camper/traveller!!!
Firstly, the position of Beach Melati is pretty good.  Definitely not beachside but with a small lane leading to the beach, it's almost as good as.  The lane, by the way, is quite narrow and dark, so not ideal if you're on a bike/moped or walking by yourself after dark!!
There's roughly a dozen or so apartments that all centre around the pool - ground floor and first floor - one, two and three bedrooms.  We booked a one bedroom apartment but were given a two bedroom apartment for the same price...however if we "physically" used the second bedroom we would be charged - but it was nice to have somewhere to throw our suitcases!!
First impressions on entering the complex were pretty amazed.  The pool was lovely but not overly big considering how many people could be using it if the place was at full capacity.  There's a bit of shade happening too and not a great deal of space for sunbaking but as my husband and I are beach people, this didn't bother us in the slightest.
When we walked into our apartment (ground floor) I was over the moon!  The place was HUGE.  Full lounge, bar, 4 person dining table, full kitchen and decent size bathroom that is located between the 2 bedrooms.  Our room backed onto the street and I was a little worried about late night noise or early morning but neither were a problem.
To be honest, we didn't see the staff very much so I can't honestly critic them but our apartment was always very clean, so no complaints there!
Beach Melati is situated in more of the Legian district than Seminyak so we found shopping and eating out way cheaper than in the more upmarket Seminyak area...but obviously not the same calibre or wonderful choices that you have in somewhere like eat street.
My husband and I always hire mopeds when in Bali so getting around is never an issue for us and visiting Kuta (don't know why you would!) or Seminyak, Canggu or Ubud is easy.  If you're relying on taxi's then be prepared for lots of traffic (no matter what time of day you're travelling!!) and therefore, excruciatingly slow sometimes...always leave yourself plenty of time to get somewhere!
I think Beach Melati is EXCEPTIONAL value for money.  I would not hesitate to stay here again and would gladly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in this area.
title: Amazing find!

text:
If you're looking to read an interesting novel - go read a book. But if this is your first time in Bali? Or looking for great accomadation STAY HERE!! 

My partner and I stayed at the most AMAZING "Beach Melati Apartments" last month in September. We are both in our early 30's, and were looking for something that was private, ages away from the party scene, but still central incase one of us got a sniff lol? (That he ended up doing) 
Trust me - stay here!! If you're not into noise, but want to be central to restaurants, beaches, shopping and most importantly somewhere, where you feel safe then this is it. 

We flew from Christchurch, New Zealand a day after the fuel crisis had happened in Auckland Airport. 70% of flights had been cancelled, just. Our 9 hour flight turned into a 15 hour flight. Unsure of our new surroundings, and feeling jet lagged, as it was our first time visiting (don't ever tell anyone that!) we finally arrived in Bali. 
Such a surreal feeling after all the horror stories you hear, especially going through customs - it was pleasantly calm, and all the staff were more than welcoming. As long as you don't have drugs.. If they're up your bum, you're still gonna caught. Don't do it!!

Through Beach Melati Apartments we had organised a driver who was waiting at the airport for us , with a bright yellow sign, that stuck out like dog balls, our name on the front beating every other person there, it instantly stood out.
Yuda was our driver, and has become our lifelong friend.

When we arrived at the apartments the beautiful Jinae greeted us. She is also from New Zealand, and speaks both English and Balinese. This is a huge advantage, as she went above and beyond and more, and was able to tend to all of our needs. From organising day trips, to the dentist, concerts, or just a friend - she's one amazing lady who definitely made our trip the "best trip of or lives" and yes,200% returning - if you're not booked out!!
title: Best trip!!

text:
We have 3 kids so finding decent accommodation is hard. Its either adjoining rooms or bunk beds with no privacy (for the teenagers of course). We've done the Dynasty as a family and this wins hands down. I've done the Jayakarta with mates and this easily wins.

We stayed for 3 weeks in a 3 bedroom (302) at the Beach Melati  and it was HUGE. When our eldest son went home early for work, my sister and brother-in law stayed with us and it was still huge. Calling out for someone doesn't work because they may be all the way out on the wrap around balcony. This isn't just somewhere to stay - you could live here. We had a snoop around some other rooms that were vacant and they look just as good.

The staff here are fantastic. They are all very professional, make a great personal effort and will work around you. They helped us with everything and really made all my family feel welcome. Again as a family this was good for our younger kid. 

Its an apartment so you feed yourself or eat out. We did breaky in the apartment some days but mostly hit the many local joints. Again, Jinae or the others will offer any advise you may need. Apart from food, the service provided covers everything else you'd get in a resort.

When we return to Bali we will be staying here.
title: Fanatastic family holiday

text:
This was my first time in Bali and Beach Melati Apartments made the amazing experience just that much more incredible. Apartment 302 was where we stayed and from top to bottom it was an absolute pleasure. The amount of space in the place was fantastic, felt like we could spread out to no end and relax without ever feeling cramped, hugely spacious. The apartment is decorated with some vibrant art and furniture, a generous amount of utilities, an incredible bathroom with an amazing shower. Water cooler is a great bonus and the beds are huge and very comfortable. Top pick for the place would be the balcony - spacious and wrapping around the side of the apartment it provided an excellent space to relax and unwind with a great view straight into Legian. The apartment complex itself is beautiful. Very relaxing with a large pool in the centre, Jinae and the staff there are incredibly helpful with everything from advice, servicing the apartment, getting around, what to see or even just someone to chat to! Pro: it's super close to the beach which means going and getting a local culinary delight from my favourite vendor, Corn Man as much as humanly possible.
What more can I say? You need to check this great space out for yourself when you're in Bali next. Highly recommended.
title: Beach Melati Magic

owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. We are so pleased you enjoyed your stay with us. 302 is a very popular apartment. We hope to see you again in the future

text:
My wife, 2 year old son and I stayed in apartment 104 in Aug-Sep this year. Found it to be ok value for money but our apartment was definetly the most basic of the lot. As we had a long stay there (32 days) we had the whole place to our selves at one stage and got to have a look in all the apartments. All the rest are a lot nicer than the one we stayed in and are priced accordingly.

 The design of the complex is great and each apartment is unique however if you have small children you would want to be very careful with the gaps in the stairway railing and balcony's upstairs. The small pool was good temp and cleaned daily.

The Apartments can be hard to find and we found all the taxi's, transport guys etc will take you to the Melasti Hotel because they are not aware of the Beach Melati and there is absolutely no pernament parking out front for a car and even bikes are a hassle with every business in the vicinity choosing to park on there tiny bit of allotted space out front.The path that leads to the Beach Melati entrance is nice and private and we really enjoyed walking our son down the shaded path to the beach most mornings.

As with most places we've stayed in Bali the staff are friendly and helpful especially with our 2 year old son. The rooms are cleaned daily, other than that they leave you to do your own thing unless you need something and they are onto it straight away.

If we were coming back with a group of friends or family the 2 & 3 beroom apartments would be awesome, they really are finished off nicely and spacious however because its such a small and quiet complex we think our son will be wanting to run amok abit too much for us to stay again anytime soon!
title: Our stay at Beach Melati Apartments

text: We recently stayed here for 15 days in July/August. We have travelled to Bali many times and always stayed at a resort. This time we decided to try something different. Very happy we did,. It was a pleasure to stay there. Its easy to book on line. The manager Jinae is very profesional and friendly. The apartment has high walls surrounding ,located in the middle of Legian close to shops and restaurants, If you dont feel like going out, there are restaurants close by that will deliver to your door. My husband & I shared with my sister, We stayed on second floor 204, 2 bedroom. Rooms are tastefully decorated and spacious, cleaned everyday to a high standard . The staff were happy to please and very friendly, security 24/7.  I would not advise using the side lane at night. What more can I say but I will certainly be going back !
title: Excellent

owner_response.text: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write a review. I agree that the gang to the beach is very dark and wouldn't recommend using that short cut at night. It's very easy to cut through some of the neighbouring hotels to get to the beach or restaurants. We look forward to your next stay
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We just spent 6 nights at Beach Melati Apartments. 2 families, both with 2 children. Apartment 101 & 102. The apartments were very clean and serviced daily. Both apartments are ground floor with direct access to the pool. On the western side of the building, away from the road.
The staff were always friendly and helpful. Thanks Jinae, Aris & Gede. 
Apartment 102 has been recently updated with all new furniture and looks great. The second bedroom has 2 single beds and is a little bit small, with no wardrobes. This apartment has air conditioning in all rooms, but no ceiling fans and the bathroom is within the main bedroom area(toilet seperate to bathroom). So may not suit couples sharing, but ok for a family.
Apartment 101 was very spacious with modern furnishings. 2nd bedroom has 2 single beds and is spacious. All rooms have ceiling fans and air conditioning. Bathroom and toilet together.
The pool is small compared to a resort. We still swam daily and the pool was never crowded.
Location is central to all the great Legian restuarants. There is currently construction around the apartments with new buildings going up. The noise was never an issue, however traffic out the front was at times congested. 
The lane to beach is private with no traffic access for about 100 metres. It then joins another lane that has motorbike access and is very narrow, we only encountered a few bikes and they always stopped and allowed us past. At night the lane can be quite dark and we took a small torch. 
Circle K across the road was handy for drinks and food. Bintang Supermarket is not far in a taxi and you can find most grocery items there. 
Enjoyed our stay at the Beach Melati Apartments.
title: 'Good choice'

owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback, especially on apartment 102 which has been renovated in the last month. We will pass your comments on to the new owners. Our staff have been with us for many years and it's great to hear your compliments of them. We hope to see you again in the future
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
My husband and I have just returned from our fifth visit to Beach Melati .
Our appartment 203 is perfect for a couple and spacious enough for us to spread out .
Appartment was spotless when we arrived and a nice touch is the addition of some welcome amenities such as tea coffee milk and mozzie repellent. 
Staff are friendly and helpful . Complex was not busy when we stayed. 
Close to shops ,transport, restaurants and beach access down the laneway .
Since our last visit,  the outdoor recliners and tables and seating around pool and on our balcony is new and comfy.
One suggestion would be a hairdryer in room . No big deal but would be handy.
Room was spotless after daily clean and a haven to retreat into after a long day at beach or shopping. 
I have recommended lots of friends to stay here and all are happy to return to Beach Melati.
title: Another relaxing stay at Beach Melati

text:
We have just had the pleasure of calling Melati home for the past week- and it really did feel like home. The apartment itself was gorgeous and everything was in perfect working order. It was spotlessly clean when we arrived and with daily (!) housekeeping, continued to be so. The complex is in a fantastic position - a little more quiet than Kuta but only a 3 min walk down a quirky little alley to the beach. A twenty minute walk along the beach shoreline saw us at Ku DeTa and Bintang supermarket is a five minute scoot away ;)
All of the above leads to a great holiday and that it was. But the difference between Melati and other places I have stayed, is the staff. There was never anything at all that was a bother- all staff even humoured my 4 year old while she told them her long and convoluted stories. When my 8 month old had a relapse of his cold from the week before one of the guys jumped on his scooter and went and got him some 'Vicks' and baby panadol-he could have just given me the directions to the pharmacy but to him it was genuinely no problem.
The manager of the property Jinae is full of info and on top of going above and beyond is also friendly and great to have a laugh with.

We got home two days ago. I booked our next stay at Melati today. Nuff said really!
title: So much warmth- nothing too much trouble!

owner_response.text:
Hi Tahlia
Thank you so much for your review. The staff loved having you and your family stay with us and  look forward to seeing you again
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Recently returned from our holiday to Bali, we have been travelling there since 1985 on a regular basis and have stayed in many varied accommodation over the years.

This was our tenth stay at Melati since 2005, we usually split our time in Bali between Legian / Sanu/ Nusa Lembongan but we always look forward to our time at Melati.

Depending on how many of the family travel we can always find the apartment to suit. Our recent stay was in the penthouse and I must say that the new owner has made some great changes to the spaces in the bedrooms, all now have TV's and new soft furnishings. We have recommended the apartments to many friends and family members and have not had one complaint !!
The beauty of the apartments is that you have a separate living space to the bedrooms and  either a balcony or veranda for those afternoon drinks.    

The location is perfect for our needs, a short walk to the beach and restaurants in one direction and not too far from Legian Street for a bit of retail therapy in the other. 
Jinea and the boys are brilliant, the rooms are cleaned daily and nothing is too much trouble. 

If your looking for a large resort with swim up bar, kids club and bebe guns this ISNT the place for you.
 It is a quiet oasis that makes me feel safe and secure when outside on the street its madness !
title: Our home away from home

text: We stayed here as a family of four for several nights.  At first we were in the Penthouse Suite, and I would highly recommend this room, particularly if you had a larger group, as it is lovely, clean, big and has televisions in 3 rooms.   Although we then moved on to another room in the apartments, when it was discovered that the television in our new room didn't work properly, the management very kindly allowed us to move back to the Penthouse Suite for the remainder of our stay.  The staff we met, including the manager and also Aris, were very friendly, pleasant and helpful with everything.  One of the greatest assets about these apartments is that you can easily step out on to the street for some shopping and get a coffee at Mugshots nearby, or walk a short way to the beautiful nearby beach for a buffet breakfast or dinner.  Beach Melati Apartments is a great place to stay for easy access to shopping, restaurants and beaches.  It wasn't a quiet place at night, because our bedroom was near the streets below, but this wasn't too bad, and there is a beautiful outdoor deck so you can have dinner outside or enjoy a book.  The kids also really enjoyed swimming in the pool.
title: Convenient and Pleasant Stay

text:
Beach Melati is situated down a little gang way in Legian, very centrally located and an easy beachfront walk to Kuta.  The Apartments are decorated in modern and comtempory in design , they are clean ,fresh and I always feel I'm in my own private resort.  
On arrival we were greeted by a friendly staff member who welcomed us back as this trip was the third time we had stayed Beach Melati and it was great knowing that most of the staff were the same from when we were there in 2009.
From the moment we booked with Tracey in Sydney until the time we checked out everything ran very smooth, nothing was a problem with the staff, we were advised that the manager had recently been admitted to hospital , but the staff were on hand to assist with anything we required. 
We moved to our next location in Legian (Baleka Spa Resort) which is just accross the road from Beach Melati and I have to say the recent renovations have made the place 100% better since I visited someone there back in 2009.  The first room we stayed in was average, the room itself had been renovated but the bathroom had not been touched and the shower was terrible.  I quickly reported this to management and was advised that we could move after 7 days into another room.  I then made the decision that we had been spoilt at Beach Melati and our next trip, instead of moving around we are staying put at the apartments.
I was astounded by the poor review of this place by an obvious disgruntled customer as I have never witnessed anything he is saying, but each to their own, we loved it and will be back again in September.  Cannot wait!
title: Best Ever Stay in Bali

text:
A group of 5 of us just got back from a week of R n R at Beach Melasti Apartments. It was a great base for a shopping, eating, drinking and relaxing! 
We called apartment 301 home for the week and it was a home away from home. It was huge!
Nice and clean with aircon in every room (Not great in the first bedroom due to postions of unit) and fans in the first and second bedrooms. 
With a full kitchen at our disposal, we took the 5 minute ride to Bingtang Supermarket and were able to stock up on water, bingtang and snacks for the afternoons spent out on our balcony.
The weather was nice and I swam everyday, the pool was always clean and we had it to ourselves most of the time. 
Jinae and the boys are great and couldn't help us more with anything! Any questions I had were answered in a heart beat. The driver they recommend Kadek was fantastic and took us anywhere we wanted to go, as well as introduce us to different places to eat and see.
The Spa Inner Glow around the corner was good value and they had a sterializtion machine for mani pedi instruments!
All in all we had a great trip and will be coming back to Beach Melati Apartments as soon as we can!
title: Fantastic Time

text: We had the bad experience of staying here last year, all be it one night. We then checked out and look elsewhere. To qualify that, we have stayed all over Bali and Lombok over the last 20 years and in all types of accommodation but this is the first time we have walked out of somewhere costing us money. We stayed there after reading comments on trip advisor which must have been written by the owners. It is or should I say the room I stayed in was dirty, moldy, noisy, and dark. The staff clearly can't stand the management as they spoke quite horribully about them and we found the very rude ourselves. We thought the fact it was owned and run by Aussie it might be good and we were sorely mistaken. Again to qualify we know things never quite go as expected in Bali and that's part of the appeal however this left a sour taste in our mouth and would prefer to stop it happening to other unless you knew these matters where address.
title: Worst place in Bali

text:
We (6 girl friends) shared apartment 301, 3 bedroom on top floor which was great. Large spacious, clean apartment with air con and everything you'd need.  Down to iPod speaker, water cooler (needed to buy big water bottle but only worked out to $2!!), Australian plug adaptors, tea towel, washing up liquid !  Air con was great, in all rooms except the main bedroom.  The ensuite to this room was massive although the bathroom was tiny in comparison but we all shared around so wasn't a problem.

Apartment was serviced daily with new towels if required and general tidy around and beds made so in that respect was abit like a hotel.  Would recommend Mugshots Cafe for a great coffee and ham and cheese toasted croissant in the mornings.  Just down from there is a little bar called Rickys which we went to on the first night and had the best and cheapest cocktails all holiday there !  In some places we swore there was no alcohol in them, but when you look at the local price of spirits then it wouldn't surprise me if that was the case !

Pick up from the airport arranged via the apartments which worked well upon arrival but going back we hailed 2 Bluebird Taxis off the street as always lots of taxis going by.

Walked into Kuta via the beach road/path and that took half an hour to the hard rock cafe at a brisk pace so not too far.

All in all a good find and we would definately book again as good value too.
title: Great Find

text: we (2 couples) stayed in apt 204 on 2nd flr, I requested well in advance 2 x queen sized beds, only had 1 so asked for 2 sgl beds to be put together (which were uneven in height anyway) so  this never happened, Jinae was not at all fussed, there is no atmosphere, after having stayed at a villa & hotel I will never stay here again.  We did look at apt called BALI COURT which are not far from here, they were absolutely lovely, decorated & spacious, check them out, & not much difference in price. I know you get what you pay for!! But this apt was not comfortable at all.
title: average

text: Extremely clean and prefectly located.  After four nights in a resort in Ubud this was a change. It was a great base.  Airconditioned and quite large rooms.  We had two families in different units both located on the floor (recommend).  Considering it was school holidays we felt we were the only ones there.  Perfect for a group but certainly not a resort but a serviced apartment.
title: PERFECT LOCATION & SUITABLE FOR A FAMILY OR GROUP

text:
As a group of eight people including two young children, we found Beach Melati to perfectly suit our needs.  We had the three bedroom apartment on the top level (room 301) and a one bedroom apartment on the middle level (room 203).  Both rooms were very nicely fitted out, quiet and well maintained. 
The outlook from room 301 onto surrounding trees is attractive.  This apartment is very well laid out and spacious enough for four adults and two children to spread out. The air conditioning works well.  The only downside is that it is a long climb up and down the stairs when using the pool. (The staff allowed us to use a bathroom on the ground floor to avoid the climb though).
Room 203 is perfectly functional for a couple.  There is no dining table inside but you can sit at a bench or at the table on the balcony to eat.
The pool and the area around it are small but work really well.  We very often had the pool to ourselves. The people in the rooms surrounding the pool tend to use their own seating rather than use the sun lounges. The main pool is very deep, but the adjoining smaller area is shallow which suited our 3 year old.
The service is exceptional, with nothing too much trouble for the manager or staff.  The apartments are cleaned throroughly each day and the communal areas are spotless.
Beach Melati is well located if you want to stay in Legian.  Mugshot Cafe (with good western style coffee and meals) is very near and there is a number of decent restaurants/warungs that deliver to your room or to the pool for no charge.  The beach is a short walk away down a narrow lane and there are good restaurants there too.  There is also a Circle K convenience store nearby which is well stocked and has an ATM and reliable money changer.
My only real criticism is that the railing on the stairs and around the balconies is deficienct from a safely perspective and we had to keep a close eye on our children when they were outside.
Overall we all thought that the accommodation was very good and would recommend it if you would rather a self contained apartment to a hotel-style experience.
title: Well serviced apartments close to the action

text:
We stayed here as a family (2 adults and 2 kids aged 4 & 7) for 11 nights. We were located in 105. 

Pros:
- enormous and clean, 
- furniture comfortable,
- fridge large, 
- tv worked well, 
- fantastic water pressure in the bathroom, 
- airconditioning freezing cold, 
- sheets & towels clean and white. 
- Pool well looked after and great temperature, kids section of pool, enough mix of sun and shade throughout the day, 
- excellent location, 
- staff friendly and helpful (in particular Jinae who was helpful, friendly and accommodating).
- water available to fill water well in room for reasonable price
- internet available (at cost)

Cons:
- full length of pool is one depth - DEEP. Can not touch the bottom at any point.
- everyone walks past 105 to get to their rooms
- no breakfast (we knew this, but it is a con)
- have to pay for internet usage
- no powerpoint in bathroom

We loved staying here and thoroughly recommend it to anyone considering it
title: Great facilities, excellent staff

text: My family and I stayed here recently after a dreadful experience at another villa.  Janae - the manager, could not have been helpful, friendly and accommodating.  She went out of her way make our last week in Bali just perfect!  And the accommodation was just gorgeous!  We had the 3 bedroom apartment, and I just don't think you can beat it!  We rarely needed to use the air-con as being on the 3rd floor and with glass doors that open out onto the balcony, the breeze was beautiful almost every day. The beds are super comfortable and the rooms very spacious.  The walk to the beach is only short, approx. 3 mins down a little lane.  This place is a real find - and we will be back for sure!!

text: A really good recommendation to stay at the Beach Melati Apartments.  The whole complex was just amazing.  The staff and Reception lady (Jinae) where all so happy to provide excellent services.  For a week I stayed in the Penthouse (3 bedroom) apartment 301.  I had the best time.  The apartment was huge and had everything and more I needed.  The decking around the apartment stretched all around and I had beautiful views.  I would highly recommend these apartments and especially apt 301.  I will be back for sure.  In fact I would love to be there all year round.  Just loved it..

text:
I travelled here with my partner after several previous trips to Bali.

We'd previously stayed in Nusa Dua, Kuta and Legian, but I wouldn't hesitate to say these apartments are the perfect combination for location, access to the beach, close to the action, but quiet enough for some sleep-ins, and a quick jump in the pool when the sun is up.

For the price, I can't recommend this place highly enough.
title: Great location, service, amenities and value - loved it.

text: I didn't get to stay at these apartments because our dates changed and the owners advised that they could not transfer payment to the other dates.  There is no cancellation policy anywhere, so be very cautious about booking here.
title: Be careful with your booking

owner_response.text: We are sorry we could not offer a refund but our website clearly states our cancellation policy. If we can re-rent an apartment for the dates booked, we always refund deposit. We will also transfer deposit to alternative dates. It was unfortunate you had to cancel on the 16 June for an 18 June booking as we could not re rent with such late notice.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Arriving at Melati Apartments is no fanfare affair. To be honest, it's stuck behind a cafe with a high wall around it. No reception to speak of. This could be disconcerting for travelers used to the grand (but wasteful) foyers in Bali hotels.

So that's the bad news (for those who enjoy those big empty voids at the front of the hotel).

The rest is all good. 

This is very different living to your hotel style living. If you like a resort, please read this paragraph. If you like a villa, skip to the next one. The reason I do this is that I have found many people like different things in Bali. So one review doesn't fit the bill!

Resort lovers: you will like the communal pool. But you will LOVE the room you have to live in! We stayed in a 2bdrm apartment on the ground floor, right next to the pool. You would pay a fortune at Santika Beach Hotel (for example), for this privilege, and it would be just a room. With this, you get a kitchen, lounge room, dining room and separate bedrooms.

if you have children, it is perfect, although if your children are rowdy, I would not recommend it. However, if your children understand the words "no bombs" and "keep it down a tad", they will be just fine!

We travel here on business, so for us, it was perfect. Plenty of room to work, wife (you need to buy it, but it's reliable, 155.000 / 24 hours).  It's serviced daily and the aforementioned cafe out the front probably does the best coffee in Bali. They also will let you run a tab. Their beer is reasonably priced, food is fresh and it's run by Aussies. Hats off to them!

For the villa lover:  you may not like the lack of privacy, but for value for money, it is much cheaper and just as spacious.

We love Villa Coco for its seclusion, but when they were booked out (I shouldn't have posted such a glowing review!!!), we booked in here instead. This is different to anything we have ever stayed at, but we give it thumbs up. 

This is so worth a try. If you stay in Bali a lot, a week out of your life won't kill you. When you are inside your apartment, it is quiet. Sleep quality is perfect, no noise at night, dark rooms.

For those with kids: get a second story apartment, or top floor. One, for safety. Two, because you can effectively 'end' pool time by going upstairs. Much more difficult if it is right their in front of them!

As a seasoned Bali traveler, (around 50 times) I have no hesitation recommending this property. It IS different, but I think it has more pluses than minuses. It beats Santika Beach hands down, and is also cheaper!!!!

Feel free to contact me with any specific questions.

Clare
title: A great find for those wanting a homely feel

text:

text:
母と夫と来たので気を使わないように２つベッドルームがある部屋を三泊予約しました。
部屋はとっても広くて綺麗で静かで良かったです！いいホテル見つけたねと家族に行ってもらえました。
キッチンはレンジやトースターやケトルはありましたがIHはありませんでした。
ちなみビーチまではホテルを出て左に曲がり突き当たりを右に曲がってそのまま道なりに左に行かずに右の突き当たりにビーチまでの小道があるのでそこを歩くと早く行けます。
お値段はまぁまぁしますがまた泊まりたいと思場所でした。
title: とっても綺麗で最高です☆

text:
Dit is een leuk, kleinschalig appartementen complexje met een eigen zwembad. Het ligt op 100 meter van het strand met een eigen prive toegangs pad.

Het ligt aan het 'Double 6' strand, wat een bekend strand in Seminyak is. Hier zijn veel goede restaurants en de golfen zijn ook goed om te surfen.

Het personeel is erg aardig en komt elke dag schoonmaken en handoeken verwisselen.

Ik kom er graag weer terug.
title: Ruim, schoon, goed gelegen, rustig, top!
